title: Demand Up For Non-toxic, Herbal Colours | Lucknow News - Times of India
author: TNN; Mar 4
description: Lucknow: Ahead of the Holi festival, markets in city are flooded with non-toxic and herbal colours.
cleaned_text: [Holi](https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/religion/festivals/holi) festival, markets in city are flooded with non-toxic and herbal colours. These herbal gulal and watercolours are prepared with a combination of various kinds of herbs like hibiscus, henna, beetroot, carrot, rose, marigold petals and sandalwood powder. As per the traders, these non-toxic herbal colours are being prepared locally with the certification from National Botanical Research Institute (NBRI). The demand for these colours is rapidly increasing as the festival nears. According to the major colour dealers, these colours are harmless on the skin and even if anyone gulps it, it wouldn't harm internally too. Colour trader Sanjay Nirupam said that they are cost-effective and will be accessible unlike other organic colours which are already existing in the market but are costly.
